title: National Hockey League - New Jersey Devils home attendance 2005 to 2019
summary: The given chart is of multi-line type with 2 lines namely Total attendance, and Average attendance. The y axis represents Home attendance and the x axis represents Year.
Overall Total attendance, and Average attendance are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Home attendance in descending order is: 1. Total attendance, and lastly, 2. Average attendance.
Throughout the period, Total attendance generally had the highest Home attendance relative to others with an average of 602148.71, and it reached its maximum at 2008/09 with a value of 647397.0.
The botommost line, Average attendance,  has a mean of 15192.86, and peaked at 2012/13.

max_summary: This is a multi-line chart with 2 lines representing Total attendance, and Average attendance. The y axis denotes Home attendance and the x axis denotes Year.
Overall Total attendance, and Average attendance are roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Total attendance, and lastly, 2. Average attendance.
Overall across the Year, Total attendance mostly maintained the highest Home attendance when compared to others with a mean value of 602148.71, and it peaked at 2008/09.
Average attendance mostly had the least Home attendance with a mean value of 15192.86, which peaked at 2012/13 with a value of 17114.0.
The greatest difference of Home attendance between Total attendance and Average attendance occurs at Year 2008/09 and the smallest difference occurs at 2012/13.
